intro: Sclerocactus scheeri subsp. brevihamatus, commonly known as the short-stemmed desert cactus, is a rare and succulent plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems that are typically green to reddish in color, covered with a thick, waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers during the spring and early summer. Its leaves are reduced to spines, which help protect it from herbivores and minimize transpiration. This subspecies is adapted to extreme desert conditions, storing water in its fleshy stems and relying on minimal rainfall for survival.
